[File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_package_local_path()] [Commit ID Validation] Is the commit_id properly validated as a valid git SHA, or can an attacker provide arbitrary strings that cause git command injection or checkout of unintended refs? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_package_local_path()] [Local Path Cloning] For SourceLocation::Local, the path is cloned directly (line 204) - are there TOCTOU vulnerabilities where the directory contents change between path resolution and actual usage? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_package_local_path()] [Async Race Condition] Can concurrent async calls to get_package_local_path() for the same remote package cause race conditions in package_cache operations, leading to corrupted or incomplete package downloads? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Infinite Recursion] Although cyclic dependencies are checked later, can an attacker craft complex dependency patterns that cause infinite recursion in the resolve_package function before the cycle check occurs, leading to stack overflow? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Manifest Path Validation] When reading the manifest at line 249, is there validation that manifest_path is actually within the expected directory, or can symbolic links redirect to arbitrary files? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Name Mismatch Attack] The check on line 258-264 verifies package name matches - but does this check occur after the package is added to the graph, allowing a brief window where the mismatched package is considered valid? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Graph Node Reuse] After adding a package to the graph (line 267-271), is the node_idx properly validated before inserting into the resolved map, or could integer overflow in NodeIndex cause aliasing? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Dev Dependencies Ordering] When dev_mode is true, dev_dependencies are chained after regular dependencies (line 275-283) - can an attacker exploit this ordering to have dev dependencies override or shadow regular dependencies? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Box::pin Recursion] The recursive call to resolve_dependency uses Box::pin (line 286) - is there potential for stack exhaustion despite pinning if the dependency tree is extremely deep? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Edge Addition Atomicity] After resolving each dependency, an edge is added to the graph (line 298) - are these operations atomic, or can concurrent modifications corrupt the graph structure? [File: third_party/move/tools/move-package-resolver/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resolve_package()] [Error Handling] If resolve_dependency fails partway through the dependency list (line 286-297), is the graph left in a partially constructed state that could be reused incorrectly? (Medium)
